metadata.title: CVE-2018-19962 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.11.x on AMD x86 platforms, possibly allowing guest OS users to gain host OS privileges because small IOMMU mappings are unsafely combined into larger ones.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.1-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.1-1
libxengnttab1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenhypfs1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenmisc4.16 - 4.11.1-1
libxenstore4 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoollog1 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.16-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.16-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.16-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-4.16 - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-common - 4.11.1-1
xenstore-utils - 4.11.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.1-1').
